com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging

Class CUILogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.fightclub.dialog.logging.CUILogger

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class CUILogger
extends java.lang.Object
    The brains of performing ASR logging in the SPEX app. Responsible for logging ASR results and audio across an entire SPEX session. Also saves each individual ASR result and associated audio as well.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  CUILogger.ErrorCallback
      Interface for a callback so that clients can receive error events when something goes wrong with the CUILogger.
      static class  CUILogger.ErrorCode
      Enumeration containing possible error and warning causes.

        Parameters:

        appInfo - Application information that is stored in the CUI logs.

    • Method Detail

      • registerErrorCallback

        public void registerErrorCallback(@NonNull
                                  CUILogger.ErrorCallback callback)
        Register for receiving error callbacks from the logger. Only one callback can be registered at a time.
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback to be registered

      • unregisterErrorCallback

        public void unregisterErrorCallback()
        Unregister from receiving error callbacks from the logger.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()

        This must be called if the logger will no longer be used. This will cleanly stop any logging sessions in progress and will safely terminate the logging thread. Failure to do so will result in a memory leak.

        Note that any public API calls after this call has been made will not be processed and are the equivalent of a no operation as the logging thread has been terminated.

      • newSession

        public void newSession(@NonNull
                       java.lang.String sessionId)
        Creates a new logging session. This should be called when the ASR session has started.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The ID to use for this session.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the provided session ID is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the sessionId is an empty string.

      • closeSession

        public void closeSession()
        Closes an open logging session. This can only be called if newSession(String) has been called previously. If not, an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.

      • startAudioRecording

        public void startAudioRecording(int recordingId)

        Enables audio recording in that it will save until the stopAudioRecording() method is called. Any ASR results that are passed into logAsrResult(AsrLogBundle) will be logged into a long form XML file that points to where in the audio the utterance is located.

        Calling this method is the equivalent of calling startAudioRecording(AudioSource, int) with a null parameter.

        Parameters:
        recordingId - The recording ID to use for the continuous files.

      • startAudioRecording

        public void startAudioRecording(@Nullable
                                AudioSource audioSource,
                                int recordingId)

        Enables audio recording in that it will save until the stopAudioRecording() method is called. Any ASR results that are passed into logAsrResult(AsrLogBundle) will be logged into a long form XML file that points to where in the audio the utterance is located.

        Passing in null or AudioSource.Unknown will result in the logger naively checking if any audio input devices are connected and use those values instead.

        Parameters:
        audioSource - The audio input source if known or null otherwise.
        recordingId - The recording ID to use for the continuous files.

      • stopAudioRecording

        public void stopAudioRecording(boolean shouldDiscard)
        Stops recording audio if startAudioRecording(int) was called previously.
        Parameters:
        shouldDiscard - If true, then this file is closed and deleted from the file system. If false, then the file is closed and is moved to its final location.

      • stopAudioRecording

        public void stopAudioRecording()
        Stops recording audio if startAudioRecording(int) was called previously and moves the file to its final resting place. This is the equivalent of calling stopAudioRecording(boolean) with false passed in as the parameter.

      • setAudioRecordingBreakpoint

        public void setAudioRecordingBreakpoint(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String name)
        Saves a "breakpoint" into the continuous, ASR XML file if a recording session is in progress. The provided name will be added to the XML file along with a timestamp corresponding to where in the audio the recording was when this breakpoint was added.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the breakpoint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the name is null.

      • recordAudioSamples

        public void recordAudioSamples(@NonNull
                               short[] samples,
                               int startIndex,
                               int length)
        Saves the given samples to a file as part of the audio recording session. Only saves the portion of the buffer that is specified.
        Parameters:
        samples - The samples to save.
        startIndex - The start offset as to where to start saving samples.
        length - The number of samples to be saved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the provided samples are null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the number of samples provided in the buffer exceeds the maximum sample size.

      • logAsrResult

        public void logAsrResult(@NonNull
                         AsrLogBundle bundle)
        Logs the provided ASR result into a discrete XML file.
        Parameters:
        bundle - An AsrLogBundle bundle instance that needs to be logged.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the provided ASR bundle is null.

      • logLocuazAlarm

        public void logLocuazAlarm(@NonNull
                           LocuazAlarmBundle bundle)
        Writes the Locuaz alarm to a file.
        Parameters:
        bundle - A LocuazAlarmBundle instance containing the information to be logged.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the LocuazAlarmBundle instance is null.

      • updateApplicationInfo

        public void updateApplicationInfo(@NonNull
                                  AppInfoBundle updatedInfo)
        Updates the currently used application information in the event of any app configuration changes.
        Parameters:
        updatedInfo - The updated application information.

      • logLocuazDialog

        public void logLocuazDialog(@NonNull
                            LocuazDialogBundle bundle)
        Writes the Locuaz conversation log to a file.
        Parameters:
        bundle - A LocuazDialogBundle instance containing the information to be logged.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if the LocuazDialogBundle instance is null.

      • enableDiagnosticLogging

        public void enableDiagnosticLogging(boolean enableDiagnosticLogging)
        Enables or disables diagnostic logging. If enabled, the user ID is recorded in the ASR and dialog log files.
        Parameters:
        enableDiagnosticLogging - If true, the user ID is recorded into certain log files.
